greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Volume of n-dimensional sphere of radius r is V_n*r^n = Pi^(n/2)*r^n/(n/2)! = C_n*Pi^floor(n/2)*r^n; sequence gives denominator of C_n.
comment: Answer to question of how to extend the sequence 1, 2 r, Pi r^2, 4 Pi r^3 / 3, Pi^2 r^4 / 2, ...
Surface area of n-dimensional sphere of radius r is n*V_n*r^(n-1).
reference: J. H. Conway and N. J. A. Sloane, "Sphere Packings, Lattices and Groups", Springer-Verlag, p. 9, Eq. 17.

Dusko Letic, Nenad Cakic, Branko Davidovic and Ivana Berkovic, Orthogonal and diagonal dimension fluxes of hyperspherical function, Advances in Difference Equations 2012, 2012:22; http://www.advancesindifferenceequations.com/content/2012/1/22. - From _N. J. A. Sloane_, Sep 04 2012
link: Eric Weisstein's World of Mathematics, Four-Dimensional Geometry
formula: (n/2)! if n even, n!! if n odd.
mathematica: f[n_] := Pi^(n/2 - Floor[n/2])/(n/2)!; Table[ Denominator[ f[n]], {n, 0, 30} ]
results.author: _N. J. A. Sloane_, Jul 31 2002
